name: particleboard production, uncoated, from virgin wood | particleboard, uncoated | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22493/documentation

This dataset represents particleboard production (uncoated, with average density of 680kg/m³, and 8% moisture content), for indoor use (furniture industry), from virgin wood (eucalyptus species).

From reception of raw materials at the factory gate. Includes the inputs to the production processes and the main process emissions.

Until and including loading of the product on lorries. Capital goods, such as industrial machinery, as well as personnel activities, for instance, transport of workers to and from the workplace, were not included within the system boundary.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/162:Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials/1621:Manufacture of veneer sheets and wood-based panels

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for Brazil used for Center-South Region
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Particleboard production is characterized by the use of wood coming from dedicated eucalyptus plantations. The main activities included in the industrial production are: reception and storage of wood logs; production, drying and classification of particles; blending; mat forming and pressing; and finishing.  Stored wood logs are debarked and chips and flakes are produced using choppers and ring flakers. The wood particles are then dried and classified. The larger particles form the internal layer of the panel, while the smaller ones are incorporated in the external layers. Bark and other wood residues from the manufacturing process as well as heavy fuel oil are burned to produce hot gas for particle drying and hot pressing processes. The dried particles are then blended with the synthetic adhesive and a mat of glued particles is made using feeding machines which form the three layers of the panel. The next steps are the pre-pressing and hot pressing (160-200ºC) of the mat to consolidate the panel. Afterwards, the panel is cut to the final dimensions and sanded.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Inventory data for the industrial production consisted of average data obtained from particleboard manufacturing companies in Brazil. Data for three companies, located in the States of São Paulo and Minas Gerais, representing 57.0% of the Brazilian particleboard production, for furniture application, was collected. Average values representing one year of particleboard production were obtained from on-site measurements and internal company documents such as records of raw material consumption, emissions and waste management inventories, during 2011 and 2012.  When process input/output data was not avaiable, secondary data were used from literature.

Based on data from Silva et al. (2013). This amount was calculated from on-site measurements and internal company documents such as records of raw material consumption. It is a additive used with urea-formaldehyde (UF) resin, which  improves  the  hygroscopic  properties  of  the  panel. In general, it is applied up tol 1 % of the UF resin weight (dry base), with solid content of 60 %.

exchanges.description: Based on data from Silva et al. (2013). This amount was calculated from on-site measurements and internal company documents such as records of raw material consumption. It corresponds to about 38.5 kg of wood fuel. Most part are from barks and other wood residues, and they are used during steam production in industrial boilers. This amount has been splitted evenly between bark chips and wood residues (slab and siding).

exchanges.description: Based on data from Chipanski (2006), who studied particleboard/MDP production in Brazil and classified the panels according to their emissions of free formaldehyde. Free formaldehyde air emissions are related to urea-formaldehyde (UF) resin use during the manufacture phase of particleboards.

Based on data from Wilson et al. (2009), who studied lifecyle inventory of particleboard/MDP production in the USA. It is related to the drying process (VOCs emissions from wood particles) and the hot pressing process of the mat (cure of the resin during the pressing cycle).
Based on data from Silva et al. (2013). This amount was calculated using GaBi software and databases version 4.4 Professional.It is related to the consumption of heavy fuel oil in industrial boilers.
Based on data from Silva et al. (2013). This amount was calculated using GaBi software and databases version 4.4 Professional.It is related to the consumption of wood fuel.

Based on data from Silva et al. (2013).This amount was calculated using GaBi software and databases version 4.4 Professional.It is related to the consumption of nonrenewable energy resources (diesel, heavy fuel oil) and wood fuel.

Estimate based on expert opinion; 0.2% of the carbon present in diesel is emitted as carbon monoxide, while 99.8% is emitted as carbon dioxide; 0.01% of the carbon present in heavy fuel oil is emitted as carbon monoxide, while 99.99% is emitted as carbon dioxide.

Based on data from Silva et al. (2013). This amount was calculated from on-site measurements and internal company documents such as records of raw material consumption. It shows about 5 % of sulphur, and is used during steam production in industrial boilers.

Calculated value based on Silva et al. (2013). Since the fuel for the furnace is included in the input, The corresponding amount inventoried with the energy module is subtracted. Since the volume of the chips is bulked, it is higher than the difference of the in- and output volume.
